info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 25 at 4:52PM CDT until May 25 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN MADISON COUNTY IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS... NORTHEASTERN ST. CHARLES AND NORTHEASTERN ST. LOUIS COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI AND NORTHERN ST. LOUIS CITY... At 451 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Riverview, moving northwest at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Ferguson, St. John, Dellwood, Woodson Terrace, Kinloch and Edmundson around 455 PM CDT. Alton, Hazelwood, Berkeley, Black Jack, Spanish Lake and Calverton Park around 500 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Florissant, West Alton, Portage Des Sioux and Orchard Farms. This also includes Scott Joplin Historic Site and Horseshoe Lake State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
